definitions.definition: An archaic stringed instrument associated particularly with Wales , though once played widely in Europe , and characterized by a vaulted back and enough space for the player to stop each of the six strings on the fingerboard .  Played variously by plucking or bowing .

main_definition: ( historical ) An archaic stringed instrument associated particularly with Wales , though once played widely in Europe , and characterized by a vaulted back and enough space for the player to stop each of the six strings on the fingerboard .  Played variously by plucking or bowing .
